node.title: Senior Rebels bikie arrested after alleged drug bust at his inner-city apartment
node.alt: Two men walk outside the courts. One man's face is covered by an umbrella.
node.description: One of Canberra's most senior outlaw motorcycle gang members faces court after being arrested by police in the city's inner-north on Thursday night.
node.content:
["One of Canberra's most senior bikie members\u00a0has been charged with drug trafficking, after\u00a0police allegedly found suspected\u00a0cocaine,\u00a0cash and a set of knuckledusters at his inner-north unit.", "John Donald Wright, 46, appeared in the ACT Magistrates Court this morning charged with drug trafficking, possessing a prohibited weapon, and failing to comply with a legal order to unlock electronic devices.", "The Rebels vice-president, who also goes by the name John Winchester, was arrested by detectives from Taskforce Nemesis, who swooped on the high-ranking bikie as he sat in a car on Mort Street in Braddon, near Canberra's city centre.", "Taskforce Nemesis is the ACT Policing's anti-gang unit.", "In court today, Mr Wright was granted bail under strict conditions, despite objections from the prosecution.\u00a0", "", "
Mr Wright faced the ACT Magistrates Court on Friday morning.(ABC News: Ian Cutmore)
", "
Drugs in sock and\u00a0knuckledusters in fruit bowl, police allege
", "A statement of facts tendered to court on Friday morning said\u00a0detectives took Mr Wright to a unit after his arrest and executed a search warrant.\u00a0", "It is alleged they found 60 grams of a white substance suspected to be cocaine hidden in a sock in a bedroom and under a kitchen sink.", "Police also said they seized electronic scales and a pair of knuckledusters in a fruit bowl, alongside two phones which Mr Wright allegedly refused to unlock.\u00a0", "In court today,\u00a0prosecutor Sam Bargwanna said police expected to obtain a court order to force Mr Wright to open the phones.", "Mr Bargwanna told the court the police suspected the phones would reveal information about the alleged drug trafficking.", "Despite objections from Mr Bargwanna, Magistrate James Lawton granted Mr Wright bail under strict conditions.", "He will return to court next month."]
